post.author: David_020
post.body:
I thought I'd share the new contest details from id's site:

"Submissions for our Quake 4 Community Map Pak have begun rolling in and with the January 31st deadline slowly approaching we would like to address the questions that have been brought up with the announcement of the Q4CMP Contest.

What gametypes does the Q4CMP seek to include?

* We are accepting submissions that include support for any of the following gametypes: 1v1, Team Deathmatch, CTF, Arena CTF and DeadZone.

I understand custom textures cannot be used, but what about custom materials and fx files?

* You may include custom script files such as fx and material files, but you may not include or reference custom textures, models or sound files.

How many entries am I allowed to submit?

* Submit as many as you like! We are accepting both existing community maps that have already been released as well as new creations.

What format should I submit the map?

* We prefer that maps be properly packaged with their .map, .proc, .cm, .def and loadscreen screenshot files, however can accept just the .map. The maps will be repackaged for both the voting process and final Community Pak.

Who will be judging the submissions?

* You! As the deadline draws near be on the lookout for an offiicial polling station near you.

Where can I find community resources and tutorials on Quake 4 map making?

* idDevNet
* Doom3World.org
* modwiki.net
* Quake3World.com
* Rust GameDesign

Please feel free to submit all questions, inquiries or submissions to SyncError. "

post.author: kat
post.body: So were is plain old vanilla DM in that list of allowed gametypes? Am I missing something here or what!?

post.author: Lukin
post.body: Well, TDM or even DZ maps fit to vanilla DM - I think they just don't want "only FFA" levels in the contest. Or they just omitted it by mistake.

post.author: kat
post.body: I'm hoping it's the latter rather than former

I thought I'd share the new contest details from id's site:

"Submissions for our Quake 4 Community Map Pak have begun rolling in and with the January 31st deadline slowly approaching we would like to address the questions that have been brought up with the announcement of the Q4CMP Contest.

What gametypes does the Q4CMP seek to include?

* We are accepting submissions that include support for any of the following gametypes: 1v1, Team Deathmatch, CTF, Arena CTF and DeadZone.

I understand custom textures cannot be used, but what about custom materials and fx files?

* You may include custom script files such as fx and material files, but you may not include or reference custom textures, models or sound files.

How many entries am I allowed to submit?

* Submit as many as you like! We are accepting both existing community maps that have already been released as well as new creations.

What format should I submit the map?

* We prefer that maps be properly packaged with their .map, .proc, .cm, .def and loadscreen screenshot files, however can accept just the .map. The maps will be repackaged for both the voting process and final Community Pak.

Who will be judging the submissions?

* You! As the deadline draws near be on the lookout for an offiicial polling station near you.

Where can I find community resources and tutorials on Quake 4 map making?

* idDevNet
* Doom3World.org
* modwiki.net
* Quake3World.com
* Rust GameDesign

Please feel free to submit all questions, inquiries or submissions to SyncError. "

onu
 Post subject:
Posted: Wed Jan 03, 2007 12:14 am 
picked up 100 armour

Joined: Tue Aug 24, 2004 4:50 am
Posts: 120
Location: Pasco, Washington, USA
BNA! wrote:
Vayne wrote:
How does 1 know which are custom and which are not?


Any good mapper has at least 2 installs for the game he's mapping for:

- The "edit version" where everything is getting thrown into
- The "clean edit version" which is nothing more than a 100% vanilla install to check for missing files in your otherwise produced map and for 100% sure stock asset mapping.


On windows I recommend using NTFS' junction points. I have a dev tree, a vanilla tree, and a tree dedicated to my team's subversion repository, all on my data drive. But Windows thinks I have just one install on my programs drive. This is done by using linkd to junction C:\Program Files\Doom 3 to the specific install of the game I want to use. This flexible setup will help windows and doom both forgive each other's differences when it comes to handling the filesystem.

It's a little complicated, but if you're juggling multiple trees it can really help.

I'd reckon that's a no as well, you can imagine what that would be like to check... they'd have to looks at the syntax of each material to make sure it was actually correct and not a half arsed hack (like I'd do!) so as not to cause any rendering or general material system errors!. well, its actually kinda simple

just check the sent in pk4 for any image files(which im sure they will allready do). off course ignore/replace the levelshot image. since you just use ingame textures to comply with you shader you merely use the game's base resources. or maybe just take an existing q4 shader and adjust it slightly like taking one of the texture layers out or simply change a certain blend effect

i know im kinda nagging with these questions, its just that its fun to take something limited and pulling something new off and see others do the same, not just geometry wise but also inventiveness.

if you cant break a limitation, you'd have to go around it id say

I thought I'd share the new contest details from id's site:

"Submissions for our Quake 4 Community Map Pak have begun rolling in and with the January 31st deadline slowly approaching we would like to address the questions that have been brought up with the announcement of the Q4CMP Contest.

What gametypes does the Q4CMP seek to include?

* We are accepting submissions that include support for any of the following gametypes: 1v1, Team Deathmatch, CTF, Arena CTF and DeadZone.

I understand custom textures cannot be used, but what about custom materials and fx files?

* You may include custom script files such as fx and material files, but you may not include or reference custom textures, models or sound files.

How many entries am I allowed to submit?

* Submit as many as you like! We are accepting both existing community maps that have already been released as well as new creations.

What format should I submit the map?

* We prefer that maps be properly packaged with their .map, .proc, .cm, .def and loadscreen screenshot files, however can accept just the .map. The maps will be repackaged for both the voting process and final Community Pak.

Who will be judging the submissions?

* You! As the deadline draws near be on the lookout for an offiicial polling station near you.

Where can I find community resources and tutorials on Quake 4 map making?

* idDevNet
* Doom3World.org
* modwiki.net
* Quake3World.com
* Rust GameDesign

Please feel free to submit all questions, inquiries or submissions to SyncError. "

post.body: The textures I see on campgrounds redux are the only 1's that look appealing to me.

post.author: SnoopJeDi
post.body:
BNA! wrote:
Vayne wrote:
How does 1 know which are custom and which are not?


Any good mapper has at least 2 installs for the game he's mapping for:

- The "edit version" where everything is getting thrown into
- The "clean edit version" which is nothing more than a 100% vanilla install to check for missing files in your otherwise produced map and for 100% sure stock asset mapping.


Or, to save disk space, different mod folders. If you do all your mapping while running a mod, your chances of screwing up the base assets are incredibly diminished.

post.author: Method
post.body:
I took a break after completing a level for DeltaCTF and now with the announcement of id's community map pak, I'm back in business so to say. Working on 1 on 1 map with Mash-Up Streets theme but more industrialized.

-Method

post.author: bolleh
post.body:
another question on my end:

custom textures not allowed, how about taking a q4 standard texture and writing a custom shader to create a new effect?

off course this is really limited as you can only go so far with this approach but still your able to change colors on some textures and creating something quite new but still a standard texture

post.author: kat
post.body: I'd reckon that's a no as well, you can imagine what that would be like to check... they'd have to looks at the syntax of each material to make sure it was actually correct and not a half arsed hack (like I'd do!) so as not to cause any rendering or general material system errors!. Quite a bit of work I would have thought

post.author: onu
post.body:
BNA! wrote:
Vayne wrote:
How does 1 know which are custom and which are not?


Any good mapper has at least 2 installs for the game he's mapping for:

- The "edit version" where everything is getting thrown into
- The "clean edit version" which is nothing more than a 100% vanilla install to check for missing files in your otherwise produced map and for 100% sure stock asset mapping.


On windows I recommend using NTFS' junction points. I have a dev tree, a vanilla tree, and a tree dedicated to my team's subversion repository, all on my data drive. But Windows thinks I have just one install on my programs drive. This is done by using linkd to junction C:\Program Files\Doom 3 to the specific install of the game I want to use. This flexible setup will help windows and doom both forgive each other's differences when it comes to handling the filesystem.

It's a little complicated, but if you're juggling multiple trees it can really help.

post.author: bolleh
post.body:
kat wrote:
I'd reckon that's a no as well, you can imagine what that would be like to check... they'd have to looks at the syntax of each material to make sure it was actually correct and not a half arsed hack (like I'd do!) so as not to cause any rendering or general material system errors!. Quite a bit of work I would have thought

well, its actually kinda simple

just check the sent in pk4 for any image files(which im sure they will allready do). off course ignore/replace the levelshot image. since you just use ingame textures to comply with you shader you merely use the game's base resources. or maybe just take an existing q4 shader and adjust it slightly like taking one of the texture layers out or simply change a certain blend effect

i know im kinda nagging with these questions, its just that its fun to take something limited and pulling something new off and see others do the same, not just geometry wise but also inventiveness.

if you cant break a limitation, you'd have to go around it id say

post.author: David_020
post.body:
I thought I'd share the new contest details from id's site:

"Submissions for our Quake 4 Community Map Pak have begun rolling in and with the January 31st deadline slowly approaching we would like to address the questions that have been brought up with the announcement of the Q4CMP Contest.

What gametypes does the Q4CMP seek to include?

* We are accepting submissions that include support for any of the following gametypes: 1v1, Team Deathmatch, CTF, Arena CTF and DeadZone.

I understand custom textures cannot be used, but what about custom materials and fx files?

* You may include custom script files such as fx and material files, but you may not include or reference custom textures, models or sound files.

How many entries am I allowed to submit?

* Submit as many as you like! We are accepting both existing community maps that have already been released as well as new creations.

What format should I submit the map?

* We prefer that maps be properly packaged with their .map, .proc, .cm, .def and loadscreen screenshot files, however can accept just the .map. The maps will be repackaged for both the voting process and final Community Pak.

Who will be judging the submissions?

* You! As the deadline draws near be on the lookout for an offiicial polling station near you.

Where can I find community resources and tutorials on Quake 4 map making?

* idDevNet
* Doom3World.org
* modwiki.net
* Quake3World.com
* Rust GameDesign

Please feel free to submit all questions, inquiries or submissions to SyncError. "

I thought I'd share the new contest details from id's site:

"Submissions for our Quake 4 Community Map Pak have begun rolling in and with the January 31st deadline slowly approaching we would like to address the questions that have been brought up with the announcement of the Q4CMP Contest.

What gametypes does the Q4CMP seek to include?

* We are accepting submissions that include support for any of the following gametypes: 1v1, Team Deathmatch, CTF, Arena CTF and DeadZone.

I understand custom textures cannot be used, but what about custom materials and fx files?

* You may include custom script files such as fx and material files, but you may not include or reference custom textures, models or sound files.

How many entries am I allowed to submit?

* Submit as many as you like! We are accepting both existing community maps that have already been released as well as new creations.

What format should I submit the map?

* We prefer that maps be properly packaged with their .map, .proc, .cm, .def and loadscreen screenshot files, however can accept just the .map. The maps will be repackaged for both the voting process and final Community Pak.

Who will be judging the submissions?

* You! As the deadline draws near be on the lookout for an offiicial polling station near you.

Where can I find community resources and tutorials on Quake 4 map making?

* idDevNet
* Doom3World.org
* modwiki.net
* Quake3World.com
* Rust GameDesign

Please feel free to submit all questions, inquiries or submissions to SyncError. "

On windows I recommend using NTFS' junction points. I have a dev tree, a vanilla tree, and a tree dedicated to my team's subversion repository, all on my data drive. But Windows thinks I have just one install on my programs drive. This is done by using linkd to junction C:\Program Files\Doom 3 to the specific install of the game I want to use. This flexible setup will help windows and doom both forgive each other's differences when it comes to handling the filesystem.

It's a little complicated, but if you're juggling multiple trees it can really help.

post.author: David_020
post.body:
I thought I'd share the new contest details from id's site:

"Submissions for our Quake 4 Community Map Pak have begun rolling in and with the January 31st deadline slowly approaching we would like to address the questions that have been brought up with the announcement of the Q4CMP Contest.

What gametypes does the Q4CMP seek to include?

* We are accepting submissions that include support for any of the following gametypes: 1v1, Team Deathmatch, CTF, Arena CTF and DeadZone.

I understand custom textures cannot be used, but what about custom materials and fx files?

* You may include custom script files such as fx and material files, but you may not include or reference custom textures, models or sound files.

How many entries am I allowed to submit?

* Submit as many as you like! We are accepting both existing community maps that have already been released as well as new creations.

What format should I submit the map?

* We prefer that maps be properly packaged with their .map, .proc, .cm, .def and loadscreen screenshot files, however can accept just the .map. The maps will be repackaged for both the voting process and final Community Pak.

Who will be judging the submissions?

* You! As the deadline draws near be on the lookout for an offiicial polling station near you.

Where can I find community resources and tutorials on Quake 4 map making?

* idDevNet
* Doom3World.org
* modwiki.net
* Quake3World.com
* Rust GameDesign

Please feel free to submit all questions, inquiries or submissions to SyncError. "

I thought I'd share the new contest details from id's site:

"Submissions for our Quake 4 Community Map Pak have begun rolling in and with the January 31st deadline slowly approaching we would like to address the questions that have been brought up with the announcement of the Q4CMP Contest.

What gametypes does the Q4CMP seek to include?

* We are accepting submissions that include support for any of the following gametypes: 1v1, Team Deathmatch, CTF, Arena CTF and DeadZone.

I understand custom textures cannot be used, but what about custom materials and fx files?

* You may include custom script files such as fx and material files, but you may not include or reference custom textures, models or sound files.

How many entries am I allowed to submit?

* Submit as many as you like! We are accepting both existing community maps that have already been released as well as new creations.

What format should I submit the map?

* We prefer that maps be properly packaged with their .map, .proc, .cm, .def and loadscreen screenshot files, however can accept just the .map. The maps will be repackaged for both the voting process and final Community Pak.

Who will be judging the submissions?

* You! As the deadline draws near be on the lookout for an offiicial polling station near you.

Where can I find community resources and tutorials on Quake 4 map making?

* idDevNet
* Doom3World.org
* modwiki.net
* Quake3World.com
* Rust GameDesign

Please feel free to submit all questions, inquiries or submissions to SyncError. "

post.author: SyncError
post.body: Updated with the answers to some of the more common questions.

post.date: Posted: Sat Jan 06, 2007 5:50 am Post subject:
post.author: SyncError
post.body:
Lukin wrote:
Well, TDM or even DZ maps fit to vanilla DM - I think they just don't want "only FFA" levels in the contest. Or they just omitted it by mistake.


Correct. Almost any map can include DM gametype support, but we do not wish entries that only support the DM gametype, as part of the reason for creating the pak is to increase the number of maps in the gametypes that need it most (ie, not DM). If your map is by first nature just a DM map, I suggest that dependent on its size you make it either 1v1 or TDM compatible.

post.date: Posted: Sun Jan 07, 2007 3:57 pm Post subject:
post.author: Koroshiya Ichi
post.body:
I've made a map for this, but unfortunately due to a number of reasons (mainly performance) I won't be submitting it.

However this is my first ever multiplayer map and if you guys could just give me some feedback on how you feel it looks visually and atmospherically and any advice that'd be greatly greatly appreciated.

The map is ideally made for 1on1 DM, or 3on3 TDM. The inspiration was the sort of 'floating castles' featured in many fantasy novels, integrated with the harsh industrial style of Quake 4 for more of an 'oil rig' theme to it. Unfortuantely due to the rules against custom models the Rock Formations were made completely from splines, greatly harming performance.

As I say though this is my first ever multiplayer map so wasn't expecting too much, if anyone could give advice on how something like this could be enhanced visually though that'd be muchly appreciated! Cheers

post.date: Posted: Sun Jan 07, 2007 4:07 pm Post subject:
post.author: 6th Venom
post.body: Damn!

post.date: Posted: Sun Jan 07, 2007 8:36 pm Post subject:
post.author: phantazm11
post.body:
In my opinion, this is one of the best looking floater maps I have seen. Great imagery. It is too bad you won't enter this into the contest.

Personally, there are a few things I'd change, but I'll stick with the two that stand out the most. First, the area in the last picture is way too dark. Lighten it up quite a bit. The other thing is the angled floating jumpads. Add detail and make them look like useful bases for the jumpads instead of triangles.

My favorite part of this map, I think, are the loading vehicles docked to receive the freight tanks. That is a great touch

[edit] You should probably post this in the WIP section instead of here.

phantazm11

post.date: Posted: Sun Jan 07, 2007 8:59 pm Post subject:
post.author: Koroshiya Ichi
post.body:
bloody hell man cheers.

I know what you mean about those specific features, to be honest though I didnt start those things until I was after the point of realising it wasn't going to be submitted, so the level of effort/enthusiasm was kinda small at that point.

I totally agree with you though, and if I ever rebuild this map I'll aim to keep the same level of detail everywhere. That room is kinda dark, contrasts a little too much with the outside style.

And im extreeeeeeemely glad you noticed the trucks recieving cargo I wasn't sure if anyone would notice that from these shots, I was scripting the crane to move along the arm too just to add to the detail. I'm glad you like it

I think i will post this in WIP though, cheers for the advice/comments its much appreciated!

post.date: Posted: Sun Jan 07, 2007 10:35 pm Post subject:
post.author: bolleh
post.body: it looks good allright but im afraid for the performance, i dont think it works very well and having it a 1 vs 1 might have been the only chance ever for this map, 4-8 would just completely kill the performance i reckon

post.date: Posted: Mon Jan 08, 2007 1:43 pm Post subject:
post.author: Koroshiya Ichi
post.body: i think i miiiiiight be able to save it yet. I'm going to drastically reduce the polycount on the rocks, have them more jagged which should hopefully help, and If i can sort some of the sections visportalling should make things a little easier.
